definition: before anything else, ranking above all others, the fielding position of the player on a baseball team who is stationed at first of the bases in the infield (counting counterclockwise from home plate)
details:
adverb
- before anything else
= example: before anything else
= synonyms: firstly, foremost, first of all, first off
- the initial time
= example: the initial time
= synonyms: for the first time
- prominently forward
= synonyms: foremost
- before another in time, space, or importance
= example: before another in time, space, or importance
adjective
- ranking above all others
= example: ranking above all others
= synonyms: foremost, world-class
- serving to begin
= synonyms: beginning
- serving to set in motion
= synonyms: inaugural, initiative, initiatory, maiden
- preceding all others in time or space or degree
= example: preceding all others in time or space or degree
- highest in pitch or chief among parts or voices or instruments or orchestra sections
= example: highest in pitch or chief among parts or voices or instruments or orchestra sections
- indicating the beginning unit in a series
noun
- the fielding position of the player on a baseball team who is stationed at first of the bases in the infield (counting counterclockwise from home plate)
= synonyms: first base
- the lowest forward gear ratio in the gear box of a motor vehicle
= synonyms: low, low gear
- an honours degree of the highest class
= synonyms: first-class honours degree
- the first element in a countable series
= example: the first element in a countable series
= synonyms: number one, number 1
- coming before all others; highest in an ordering or series
= example: coming before all others; highest in an ordering or series
= synonyms: number one
- the time at which something is supposed to begin
= synonyms: beginning
